intro: Astragalus monozyx, commonly known as the single-seed milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia, including parts of Mongolia and Siberia. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves with small leaflets. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments. Astragalus monozyx plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
